topic.title: About Management and Monitoring Utilities
topic.shortdesc: Greenplum Database provides standard command-line utilities for performing common monitoring and administration tasks.

body.p: Greenplum command-line utilities are located in the $GPHOME/bin directory and are executed on the master host. Greenplum provides utilities for the following administration tasks:

ul.li: Installing Greenplum Database on an array
Expanding the array and redistributing tables among new segments
Managing recovery for failed segment instances
Managing failover and recovery for a failed master instance
Backing up and restoring a database (in parallel)

body.p: Pivotal provides an optional system monitoring and management tool, Greenplum Command Center, which administrators can install and enable with Greenplum Database. Greenplum Command Center depends upon data collection agents on each segment host to collect and store system metrics in a dedicated database named gpperfmon. Segment data collection agents send their data to the Greenplum master at regular intervals (typically every 15 seconds). The data collection agents and the gpperfmon_install management utility, which creates the database and enables the agents, are included with Greenplum Database. Users can query the gpperfmon database to see query and system metrics. Greenplum Command Center has a graphical web-based user interface for viewing the system metrics, which administrators can install separately from Greenplum Database. For more information, see the Greenplum Command Center documentation.
